body:
https://github.com/curl/curl/blob/d755a5f7c009dd63a61b2c745180d8ba937cbfeb/include/curl/curl.h#L68-L71

FreeBSD manual [says](https://docs.freebsd.org/en/books/porters-handbook/porting-dads/#porting-versions) use `#include <sys/param.h>`.

I'm not sure why we're using osreldate, maybe for legacy reasons. What version of FreeBSD are you using? What happens if you `#include <sys/param.h>`
The include was brought in 2009, apparently to fix a build with FreeBSD < v8: https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/b89789d82fdb2df7adc8d00e7574ab0e531c3f7b

issue.title: curl.h: only include "osreldate.h" on pre v8 FreeBSD

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
Follow-up to b89789d82fdb2df. This header does not exist in all modern versions.

Fixes #12107
Reported-by: Faraz Fallahi

body:
osreldate.h should exist on any FreeBSD version, but sys/param.h is also fine for defining `__FreeBSD_version`.

Here's a rather recent commit I found when looking for details: https://github.com/freebsd/freebsd-src/commit/90eaf4b2f98f2678b3dc707f9781a887eee94b1a

FreeBSD manual also says to use `osreldate.h`, [sysctl(3)](https://man.freebsd.org/cgi/man.cgi?query=sysctl&apropos=0&sektion=3&manpath=FreeBSD+13.2-RELEASE+and+Ports&arch=default&format=html):

    The userland release version is available from <osreldate.h>;
    parse this file if you need to get the release version of the
    currently installed userland.

It's used a fair bit by the base system, [including this example of how to find the FreeBSD version](https://github.com/freebsd/freebsd-src/blob/922337e8d3989e4f54a0338b7fc397e3e0af7832/share/examples/FreeBSD_version/FreeBSD_version.c).

Thank you both @emaste and @Freaky. This seems to rather imply that either @fffaraz's setup is bad somehow or Sony has done something "fun" for the PlayStation that requires a special take.

Either way, my take in 12109 seems incorrect.

PlayStation sdk does not have `osreldate.h` but it does have `sys/param.h` and it defines `__FreeBSD_version` as
`#define __FreeBSD_version 900044    /* Master, propagated to newvers */`
FWIW, I checked a FreeBSD 6.2 image I have lying around and either `sys/param.h` or `osreldate.h` work fine to define `__FreeBSD_version`.
`osreldate.h` is generated during the build, while `sys/param.h` is a static source of truth in the source tree, used by `sys/conf/newvers.sh`.  Perhaps some setup step for the SDK's been missed?

issue.title: curl.h: on FreeBSD include sys/param.h instead of osreldate.h

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
Should things build on Playstation as well

Fixes #12107
Reported-by: Faraz Fallahi

body: Based on all the comments, I figure we can just include `sys/param.h` instead? I made #12123 for that.
